I meet the same problem, when variable is large and in distribution environment. chief worker can't initializer the large variable correctly, so i guess it is bug!
the large variable i define is:

### problem code
w0 = tf.get_variable('w_0', dtype=dtype, initializer=tf.random_uniform([100000, 256, 32], minval=minval, maxval=maxval, dtype=dtype)) 

### correct code （ just smaller first dimention size）
w0 = tf.get_variable('w_0', dtype=dtype, initializer=tf.random_uniform([30000, 256, 32], minval=minval, maxval=maxval, dtype=dtype))

I use tf.estimator.train_and_evaluate api to do distributed training, and define w0 in the model_fn. when i define w0 using[100000, 256, 32] , I can run the code in the single machine( local mode) correctly, but Error ：

### in chief
INFO:tensorflow:Create CheckpointSaverHook.
2018-03-02 12:53:31.539989: I tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/master_session.cc:1017] Start master session 001a93d5f7256838 with config: device_count { key: "GPU" value: 0 }
[[[[  blocked here ]]]]]

### in worker 0
INFO:tensorflow:Waiting for model to be ready.  Ready_for_local_init_op:  Variables not initialized: w_0, ready: None

when i only change w0 from [100000, 256, 32] to [30000, 256, 32], I can run the code correctly both in local mode and distribution mode. So large variable can't initialize correctly in distribution mode

body:
I meet the same problem, when variable is large and in distribution environment.  chief worker can't initializer the large variable correctly, so i guess it is bug!
the large variable i define is:
```
### problem code
w0 = tf.get_variable('w_0', dtype=dtype, initializer=tf.random_uniform([100000, 256, 32], minval=minval, maxval=maxval, dtype=dtype)) 

### correct code （ just smaller first dimention size）
w0 = tf.get_variable('w_0', dtype=dtype, initializer=tf.random_uniform([30000, 256, 32], minval=minval, maxval=maxval, dtype=dtype)) 
```
I use tf.estimator.train_and_evaluate api to do distributed training, and define w0 in the model_fn.  when i define w0 using[100000, 256, 32]  , I can run the code in the single machine( local mode) correctly, but Error ：
```
### in chief
INFO:tensorflow:Create CheckpointSaverHook.
2018-03-02 12:53:31.539989: I tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/master_session.cc:1017] Start master session 001a93d5f7256838 with config: device_count { key: "GPU" value: 0 }
[[[[  blocked here ]]]]]

### in worker 0
INFO:tensorflow:Waiting for model to be ready.  Ready_for_local_init_op:  Variables not initialized: w_0, ready: None
```
when i only change w0 from [100000, 256, 32] to [30000, 256, 32], I can run the code correctly both in local mode and distribution mode. So large variable can't initialize correctly in distribution mode
